Title: Progress towards a semiconductor Compton camera for prompt gamma imaging during proton beam therapy for range and dose verification
Abstract: © 2018 IOP Publishing Ltd and Sissa Medialab.The main objective of this work is to test a new semiconductor Compton camera for prompt gamma imaging. Our device is composed of three active layers: a Si(Li) detector as a scatterer and two high purity Germanium detectors as absorbers of high-energy gamma rays. We performed Monte Carlo simulations using the Geant4 toolkit to characterise the expected gamma field during proton beam therapy and have made experimental measurements of the gamma spectrum with a 60 MeV passive scattering beam irradiating a phantom. In this proceeding, we describe the status of the Compton camera and present the first preliminary measurements with radioactive sources and their corresponding reconstructed images.
AuthorKeywords: Gamma detectors (scintillators, CZT, HPG, HgI etc)
